title: How to Use the Bathroom While Camping

steps.title: Establish the boundary of your camp area and agree that all members of the group camping relieve themselves outside of the boundary avoiding streams, or, down stream if that's not possible.
steps.content: Establish the boundary of your camp area and agree that all members of the group camping relieve themselves outside of the boundary avoiding streams, or, down stream if that's not possible. Dig a latrine area if desired, for communal use. Establish a place no less than 200 feet away from the nearest water source and camp-site.

steps.title: Ensure your group, if you're in one, know where you're going.
steps.content: Ensure your group, if you're in one, know where you're going. Camping in the wild has risks, your group need to know to come look for you if you get into trouble. Bears, snakes, falls etc are risks you may face in the great outdoors. If you go off to relive yourself without telling anyone, especially at night, you could be stranded, injured for hours before anyone looks for you. Take a torch or flash light even if it's only dusk and not full dark.

steps.title: Gather what you need to "go".
steps.content: Gather what you need to "go". Take some toilet paper. If you have to defecate, be sure to take a small shovel with you to bury your waste. Take hand sanitiser with you if wanted and if required, something to carry used toilet paper back to camp in. You shouldn't contaminate pristine wilderness with toilet paper unless you have to.

steps.title: Walk out of camp as far as required.
steps.content: Walk out of camp as far as required. Find a bush, a shrub, or a boulder for added privacy.

steps.title: Go behind your cover.
steps.content: Go behind your cover. Make sure you're looking out in the direction any risks are most likely to come from.

steps.title: Pull your garment down to your knees, or lift them out of the way depending in what you're wearing.
steps.content: Pull your garment down to your knees, or lift them out of the way depending in what you're wearing. Tug your underwear halfway to your knees.

steps.title: Start pooping and keep looking forward.
steps.content: Start pooping and keep looking forward. When you think you are halfway down, stop.

steps.title: Adjust your underwear if necessary.
steps.content: Adjust your underwear if necessary.

steps.title: Hold yourself up by one hand.
steps.content: Hold yourself up by one hand. Secure your shorts with the other hand.

steps.title: Squat the rest of the way down.
steps.content: Squat the rest of the way down.

steps.title: Begin to urinate.
steps.content: Begin to urinate.

steps.title: Wipe with toilet paper or do a shake and wiggle to dry yourself.
steps.content: Wipe with toilet paper or do a shake and wiggle to dry yourself. Pack out your used toilet paper with your garbage, burn it in your campfire pit, or drop it in your pee spot. Use a odor proof bag to pack up your toilet paper and bring it with you.

steps.title: Pull your shorts up and go.
steps.content: Pull your shorts up and go. You're done!!

steps.title: Defecating while camping.
steps.content: Defecating while camping. If you need to defecate, hike 200' out and find a thick tree. Go behind it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Dig a pit where your waste will fall.
steps.content: Dig a pit where your waste will fall. This pit should be 6" deep and large enough to defecate into. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Face away from the tree and look forward.
steps.content: Face away from the tree and look forward. Pull your pants and underwear down halfway to your knees.

steps.title: Stick your bum out and over the hole.
steps.content: Stick your bum out and over the hole.

steps.title: Pull your shorts down to your knees.
steps.content: Pull your shorts down to your knees.

steps.title: Bend at the waist and at the knees.
steps.content: Bend at the waist and at the knees.

steps.title: Defecate.
steps.content: Defecate.

steps.title: Wipe with toilet paper or a leaf.
steps.content: Wipe with toilet paper or a leaf. Throw it into the hole.

steps.title: Bury your waste.
steps.content: Bury your waste. [3] X Research source
